author: marvin
msg: LUCY-161 Don't use CreateHardLink under Cygwin.
Unlike othe Windows environments, Cygwin actually provides link() in unistd.h
-- so use it instead of CreateHardLink().

author: marvin
msg: LUCY-166 Tweak #ifdef logic for various Windows environments.
Prefer POSIX on Cygwin, but prefer Windows API everywhere else on Windows,
which may provide unistd.h and signal.h but not the kill() function.

author: brett
msg: [NPANDAY-445] refactor GAC utility to be more independent and reuse from reference addition logic as well to avoid parsing paths that may not be correct
